body:
Recently a certain high profile user was perma banned so all his guilds should have been made available to siege.

Except @CaptainMeta4 decided to lock those guilds for potential sieging for an undisclosed amount of time, so regular ruqqus users had no idea their sieges would fail and end up being blocked from sieging for 30 more days.

CaptainMeta4 exclusively told everyone in his Ruqqus discord only when those guilds would become available for siege, one of them slipped up and revealed this to me when I was mad that my siege still failed.
body_html:
Recently a certain high profile user was perma banned so all his guilds should have been made available to siege.

Except @captainmeta4 decided to lock those guilds for potential sieging for an undisclosed amount of time, so regular ruqqus users had no idea their sieges would fail and end up being blocked from sieging for 30 more days.

CaptainMeta4 exclusively told everyone in his Ruqqus discord only when those guilds would become available for siege, one of them slipped up and revealed this to me when I was mad that my siege still failed.
title: The ruqqus cabal is real and here is more proof of their fuckery

body: Guilds are not available to siege immediately and the 60-day period of GM inactivity always applies. This means that a guild becomes available to siege 60 days after its only GM is banned, no sooner than that.

body:
Ok, then. Since you didn't mention the guild nobody else can check. I am just sharing some of my observations and was addressing

> user was perma banned so all his guilds should have been made available to siege

which is not as straight-forward as you say. A banned user remains a GM so their actions in the guild count towards the 60-day protection period. Only if the GM was removed (by admins if the GM was the only GM in the guild) then it is as you say.
body_html:
Ok, then. Since you didn't mention the guild nobody else can check. I am just sharing some of my observations and was addressing

user was perma banned so all his guilds should have been made available to siege

which is not as straight-forward as you say. A banned user remains a GM so their actions in the guild count towards the 60-day protection period. Only if the GM was removed (by admins if the GM was the only GM in the guild) then it is as you say.

body:
Still about Klens guilds.

They put a hidden timer on them hence why they haven't been sieged yet.

They only revealed in Discord when that timer ends (Feb 9th) so the cabal can get first dibs and not waste their siege attempts.

parent.body:
Still about Klens guilds.

They put a hidden timer on them hence why they haven't been sieged yet.

They only revealed in Discord when that timer ends (Feb 9th) so the cabal can get first dibs and not waste their siege attempts.
parent.body_html:

post.body:
Recently a certain high profile user was perma banned so all his guilds should have been made available to siege.

Except @CaptainMeta4 decided to lock those guilds for potential sieging for an undisclosed amount of time, so regular ruqqus users had no idea their sieges would fail and end up being blocked from sieging for 30 more days.

CaptainMeta4 exclusively told everyone in his Ruqqus discord only when those guilds would become available for siege, one of them slipped up and revealed this to me when I was mad that my siege still failed.
post.body_html:

parent.body: Guilds are not available to siege immediately and the 60-day period of GM inactivity always applies. This means that a guild becomes available to siege 60 days after its only GM is banned, no sooner than that.
parent.body_html: Guilds are not available to siege immediately and the 60-day period of GM inactivity always applies. This means that a guild becomes available to siege 60 days after its only GM is banned, no sooner than that.

Recently a certain high profile user was perma banned so all his guilds should have been made available to siege.

Except @CaptainMeta4 decided to lock those guilds for potential sieging for an undisclosed amount of time, so regular ruqqus users had no idea their sieges would fail and end up being blocked from sieging for 30 more days.

CaptainMeta4 exclusively told everyone in his Ruqqus discord only when those guilds would become available for siege, one of them slipped up and revealed this to me when I was mad that my siege still failed.
post.body_html:
Recently a certain high profile user was perma banned so all his guilds should have been made available to siege.

Except @captainmeta4 decided to lock those guilds for potential sieging for an undisclosed amount of time, so regular ruqqus users had no idea their sieges would fail and end up being blocked from sieging for 30 more days.

CaptainMeta4 exclusively told everyone in his Ruqqus discord only when those guilds would become available for siege, one of them slipped up and revealed this to me when I was mad that my siege still failed.
post.title: The ruqqus cabal is real and here is more proof of their fuckery
